comments: Gabe Grant
Gabriel Grant

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: For an "advanced" industrial ecology course the material and discussion was still pretty basic. The students in the class were capable of engaging in a much higher level discussion and would have benefited more from the class if challenged a bit more.

This course could be incredibly valuable for students wishing to pursue careers at the intersection of business and the environment. However, how these two concepts fit together was not well developed or articulated.

Instead of doing one big paper for the class, I would break the deliverables up into case studies or problem sets so the students can reinforce what they learn periodically throughout the semester. Paper felt too academic for the material in the course.

I really enjoyed the class. The guest speakers were all very interesting and insightful. I didn't think the weakly reading responses were necessary - with such a small class, everyone will want to read so they can participate in the discussion.

This is a great class to merge the concepts of industrial ecology with business and strategy. The classes were well thought and provided a comprehensive overview of various areas. The project was flexible enough to go deeper into a particular aspect of the class.The visiting lecturers made us think of real case applications of the concepts discussed in class. Prof Chertow, made a great job in giving depth and continuity to the discussion. It was a great idea to have a discussion board on the readings previous to the seminar (it sort of forced us to come prepared to class and make the most of the seminar time).Fantastic class, highly recommended!
Hearing presentations from students on various topics. The student presentation were focused on a variety of topics, some very unique.
Although Marian's lectures are always interesting, the lineup of guest speakers was outstanding. This includes, Alan Epstien, the gentlmen from GE, Kyle Datta, among others.
Nice blend of theory and real-world applications. Small class size also allowed for quality discussion.
Guest speakers and quality of other students comments/discussion.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Readings could be condensed or streamlined. More depth rather than breadth for the whole course in general.
Being a selfish student, I know there have been class trips in the past, and if possible it would be a great idea to offer them in the future.
The syllabus needs to be better planned. Sometimes hard to link concepts given layout of material.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: N/A

Marian told the class to contact her to discuss matters, and I did take advantage of it and she gave me some great input on my class paper. I often sent emails to Marian&Gabe, and they always sent me a reply to whatever I needed.

Marian was a wonderful professor. She was always interested in student perspective and available for discussion. Gabe was less attentive. He could have more active and flexible in helping students get through the course.
Both Prof. Chertow and Gabe were sometimes slow to respond to email but both very helpful.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: It is a cornerstone course in my focal area of Industrial Ecology
I am exploring how to attract private capital to environmental services/solutions. This course gave me a great set of examples and sectors to focus on.
Great for people interested in applying industrial ecology strategies to a range of businesses.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To learn more in depth about industrial ecology and engage in high level seminar discussions.
Important to my career pursiuts and interests.
To further my understanding of industrial ecology and explore biomass waste markets.
In line with my career interests.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: The course moved too slowly and was too basic for an advanced course.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: pick an interesting paper topic - 25 pages hard to write and research if topic not very interesting to you
Start your class paper early.
A good capstone course to your SOM/FES education. Very interdisciplinary. Brings together many concepts from across both schools.
Fantastic seminar highly recommended
